# Day 17

[Puzzle description.](https://adventofcode.com/2023/day/17)

For part 1, I realized this was a shortest path problem, but because of the movement restrictions
it wasn't just a straight-forward shortest path through the grid. Instead, I chose to model the
vertices as a combination of grid position, current direction, and steps taken. This allowed the
use of Dijkstra, which found the shortest path.

For path 2, I only needed to change which neighbors get added depending on the current number of
steps. Note that I didn't bother actually checking that at least 4 steps are taken for the end
vertex, since the shortest path found does that anyway in my input so the check wasn't needed.

Path taken for part 1:
